Sentence.sentence: There is no best parenting style or philosophy, researchers say, and across income groups, 92% of parents say they are doing a good job at raising their children.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Many have argued that the women designers of this time were able to project their own clothing values into a new style.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The form and style are very familiar, and best of all, you are the world-class expert on the subject of YOU .
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It is written in a lively and interesting style.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Leadership is the most significant word in today's competitive business environment because it directs the manager of a business to focus inward on their personal capabilities and style.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: When Stephen Covey, founder and director of the Leadership Institute, explored leadership styles in the past decade, he focused on the habits of a great number of highly effective individuals.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It will produce business leaders of a uniform style.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: What does Mannaz say about the current management style
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A study by Mannaz, a leadership development company, suggests that, while the bully-boy chief executive of old may not have been eradicated completely, there is a definite shift in emphasis towards less tough styles of management – at least in America and Europe.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They are known to be the style of the sports world.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: He chose colors and styles known to communicate power and influence.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Its informal conversational style would make interaction comfortable, and yet the machine would remain slightly unpredictable and therefore interesting.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: In its first encounter it might be somewhat hesitant and unassuming, but as it came to know the user it would progress to a more relaxed and intimate style
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But according to a 2008 review, only one study that followed this design found that students actually learned best with their preferred style.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Exclusivity, more familiar in the world of high fashion, has reached the kitchen: Robinson&Cornish, a British manufacturer of custom-made kitchens, offers a Georgian style one which would cost £145,000-155,000—excluding building, plumbing and electrical w
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: his experiments resulted in a new style that was almost exactly opposite the accepted technique of the time.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The complex style of the medieval wooden church carvings and the skills used to make them almost certainly to derive from the ancient Viking tradition.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The explosive new style helped cut killy's racing time dramatically.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The researchers excluded 2/3 of the original participants, because they didn't seem to have any clear learning style from the survey at the beginning.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Then they try to teach the students something with a specific presentation style, like using visual aids, and do a follow up test to see how much they learned.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Usually they start by giving a survey to figure out what style a student favors, like visual or verbal learning.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词都含有"流行，样式"之意。
means: fashion ： 侧重指衣着、生活、行为和思想等的风尚，多含一时或一地流行的意味。
style与fashion意义相当，可换用，但现代用以强调高雅。

Sentence.sentence: Everybody wears the same style of clothes.

Sentence.sentence: I ran the risk of losing those students who had a different style of thinking.

Sentence.sentence: I recommend that you find your way in style.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: It has a modern European-style garden.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读A 选项

Sentence.sentence: It's partly true that Dickens' style of writing attracted audiences from all walks of life.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Rock music consists of many different styles.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: The style of the campus is quite different from that of most Chinese universities.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: They go out of style quickly.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷I 阅读理解 阅读D 选项

Sentence.sentence: These are disciplines that are going out of style: 22% of American college graduates now major in business compared with only 2% in history and 4% in English.

Sentence.sentence: There is no doubt that gardens evidence an impossible urge to create, express, fashion, and beautify and that self-expression is a basic human urge;  yet when one looks at the photographs of the garden created by the homeless, it strikes one that , for all their diversity of styles, these gardens speak of various other fundamental urges, beyond that of decoration and creative expression.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: These labels encourage style-conscious consumers to see clothes as disposable-meant to last only a wash or two, although they don’t advertise that –and to renew their wardrobe every few weeks.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It is only the Queen who has preserved the monarchy’s reputation with her rather ordinary ( ' , if well-heeled) granny style.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The point of a style upgrade isn’t to become more vain or to spend more time passing over what to wear.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Millennials, it seems, face the paradox of being the least formal generation yet the most conscious of style and personal branding.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Hire a personal stylist, or use the free styling service of a store like J.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: To the horror of some who expected a Greek Revival twin of the Treasury Building to be erected on the other side of the White House, the elaborate French Second Empire style design by Alfred Mullett was selected, and construction of a building to house all three departments began in June of 1871.
Sentence.come: 出自-2018年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Jokes that work one person won't necessarily land with another, So, adapt your style accordingly to type.

Sentence.sentence: millennials, it seems, face the paradox of being the least formal generation yet the most conscious of style and personal branding.

entry.def: The style of something is the general way in which it is done or presented, which often shows the attitudes of the people involved.

example.ex: Our children's different needs and learning styles created many problems...
example.tran: 孩子们不同的需求和学习方式给我们带来了许多问题。

example.ex: Belmont Park is a broad sweeping track which will suit the European style of running...
example.tran: 贝尔蒙特跑马场有宽阔的弧形跑道，很适合举行欧式赛马。

entry.def: If people or places have style, they are smart and elegant.

example.ex: Bournemouth, you have to admit, has style...
example.tran: 你不得不承认伯恩茅斯是个很有格调的地方。

example.ex: Both love doing things in style...

entry.def: The style of a product is its design.

example.ex: His 50 years of experience have given him strong convictions about style...
example.tran: 50 年的经验使得他在款式上有自己的独到见解。

example.ex: Several styles of hat were available.

entry.def: In the arts, a particular style is characteristic of a particular period or group of people.
entry.tran: (某群艺术家或某文艺时期的)风格

example.ex: ...six scenes in the style of a classical Greek tragedy.
example.tran: 6 个古典希腊悲剧式的场景

entry.def: If something such as a piece of clothing, a vehicle, or someone's hair is styled in a particular way, it is designed or shaped in that way.

example.ex: His thick blond hair had just been styled before his trip.
example.tran: 他在旅行前刚把浓密的金发修剪了一番。

entry.def: If you say that something is not someone's style, you mean that it is not the way in which they usually do things, or it is different from the sort of thing they usually like.
entry.tran: 不是…的风格;不符合…的喜好

example.ex: Mr Blair was not off guard. That is not his style...
example.tran: 布莱尔先生没有放松警惕，这不是他的风格。

example.ex: To be honest, the house is not quite our style.
example.tran: 说实话，这房子我们不是非常喜欢。

means.word_mean: 1. a particular kind (as to appearance);

sentences.sentence: "this style of shoe is in demand"

means.word_mean: 2. how something is done or how it happens;
3. a way of expressing something (in language or art or music etc.) that is characteristic of a particular person or group of people or period;

sentences.sentence: "all the reporters were expected to adopt the style of the newspaper"

means.word_mean: 4. distinctive and stylish elegance;

sentences.sentence: "he wooed her with the confident dash of a cavalry officer"

means.word_mean: 5. the popular taste at a given time;

sentences.sentence: "the 1920s had a style of their own"

means.word_mean: 6. (botany) the narrow elongated part of the pistil between the ovary and the stigma
7. editorial directions to be followed in spelling and punctuation and capitalization and typographical display
8. a pointed tool for writing or drawing or engraving;

sentences.sentence: "he drew the design on the stencil with a steel stylus"

means.word_mean: 9. a slender bristlelike or tubular process;
1. designate by an identifying term;
2. make consistent with a certain fashion or style;
3. make consistent with certain rules of style;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting a stylus, also a literary composition, an official title, or a characteristic manner of literary expression): from Old French stile, from Latin stilus. The verb dates (first in sense 2) from the early 16th cent

sentences.cn: 顾一名私人形象设计师，或使用像 J. Crew 这样的商店所提供的免费造型服务。【句子解析】本句是由or连接的并列句。分句一是祈使句，由“谓语（Hire) +宾语（a personal stylist)”构成。分句二是由“谓语（use) +宾语（the free styling service) ”构成的祈使句;介词短语of a store作后置定语，修饰the free styling service;介词短语 like J. Crew 作后置定语，修饰 a store。
